CardPickup

Class Card

  • java.lang.Object
    • CardPickup.Card
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable

    public class Card
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable
    The Card class simply represents a playing card - including its image and value.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Card()
      The default constructor creates an empty card with no value or image.
      Card(int r, int s)
      A Card class can be created by specifying the rank and suit of the card as integers.

      A Card class can be created by specifying the string description of the Card.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Card

        public Card()
        The default constructor creates an empty card with no value or image.

      • Card

        public Card(int r,
    int s)
        A Card class can be created by specifying the rank and suit of the card as integers. If the Card is given bad arguments, it will still create a Card instance, but the Card will not be usuable.
        Parameters:
        r - The rank value of the Card. Ace through King = 1 through 13
        s - The suit of the Card. Clubs = 1, Diamonds = 2, Hearts = 3, Spades = 4

      • Card

        public Card(java.lang.String desc)
        A Card class can be created by specifying the string description of the Card. If the Card is given a bad description, it will still create a Card instance, but the Card will not be usuable.
        Parameters:
        desc - The string description. "Rank of Suit" format with the rank and suit capitalized.

    • Method Detail

      • setCard

        public void setCard(int r,
           int s)
        setCard() is used to set the Card to the given rank and suit.
        Parameters:
        r - The rank value of the Card. Ace through King = 1 through 13
        s - The suit of the Card. Clubs = 1, Diamonds = 2, Hearts = 3, Spades = 4

      • getRank

        public int getRank()
        getRank() is used to get the (private) rank of this Card.
        Returns:
        The integer rank of this Card

      • getSuit

        public int getSuit()
        getSuit() is used to get the (private) suit of this Card.
        Returns:
        The integer suit of this Card

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        toString() overrides the default Object toString function and returns a string representation of the card in readable form.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The String description of this Card.

      • shortName

        public java.lang.String shortName()
        shortName() like toString() but shorter * @return The String description of this Card.

      • changeRank

        public int changeRank(int dir)
        changeRank() is used for A-Mod games where the rank can be increased or decreased by 1.
        Parameters:
        dir - The direction of the change. A positive 1 means increase the rank of the Card by 1.
        Returns:
        The new rank of the card. (note that this Card instance is also changed.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(java.lang.Object o)
        compareTo() function implements the Comparable part of this class.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable
        Parameters:
        o - The object which to compare this Card value. Must be a Card object.
        Returns:
        A negative integer if this object is less than the Card argument; zero if this Card is equal to the Card argument; a positive number if this Card is greater than the Card argument.
